page.title: 09Parish Council, Thurleigh
page.content: Thurleigh Parish Council is made up of 7 members, including the chairman, who are all democratically elected every 3 years by the village people. The Council meets every 6 weeks, plus someadditional special meetings at the Chapel Meeting House, adjoining the Baptist Chapel. The date and agenda for the meetings is advertised on the Parish noticeboard and the public and the press can attend all the meetings. The Parish Council covers a variety of work. They comment on planning applications that are submitted to the County and District Councils, liase with them on highway and public footpath matters. They also liase with the Police and deal with all general complaints and traffic problems. The street lighting belongs to the Parish. They sit on the committees of the Trusts,school, hall and playing field.
